alert.note: Alert for Chaves (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 20 at 7:41PM MDT until August 21 at 2:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Albuquerque NM has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Mexico... Pecos River Below Acme affecting Chaves County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pecos River below Acme. * WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, left bank is about 10ft above gage and subject to overflow. At 13.0 feet, inundation of low laying areas, mostly range land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM MDT Saturday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 13.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.1 feet on 07/08/1960. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Pecos River Acme 13.0 8.2 Sat 6 pm MDT 11.4 7.6 7.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning around 800 AM MDT.
